1. The paragraph mentions two locations: Toronto and Barrick Gold.
2. Toronto is a city in the province of Ontario, one of the provinces in Canada. It is a broader location that encompasses many specific locations, including buildings and companies.
3. Barrick Gold is a specific location within Toronto. It is a head office of a company and cannot contain any other location.

Therefore, the hierarchical relationship between the two locations is as follows:

| Broader Location | Specific Location | Whether the Broader Location contains the Specific Location |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Toronto | Barrick Gold | Yes |
